law.text:
As used in this section and KRS 158.6452, 158.6453, and 158.6455, unless the context requires otherwise:
"Accountability index" means the statistic, as provided by KRS 158.6455(2), that combines a school's academic and nonacademic factors;
"Core content for assessment" means the content identified for all students to know that is to be included on the state assessment; and
"Nonacademic factors" means the statistic that describes school success on:
Increasing attendance and decreasing retention rates at the elementary school level;
Increasing attendance rates and decreasing retention and dropout rates at the middle school level; and
Increasing attendance rates and decreasing retention and dropout rates and improving the transition to adult life at the secondary school level.
law.history: Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 598, sec. 1, effective April 14, 1998.
